opening: ^I don’t know what I was expecting. Nothing in the news is ever good these days.
^I wonder when mom is gonna be back… Things are starting to get scary out there.
^I think someone might be at the door
^Or in the house now! I should go check on that.
^Hunter: Hey [player], we wanted to stop by and hang.
^Janet: Someone decided they should let themselves in…
^Player: Well I always love seeing you guys. Even if I do prefer letting you in myself…
after_day_choice: ^Janet: Well at least your day hasn’t been bad!
^Hunter: Oh, [Player], where’s your mom? I was hoping she could make us some of her world famous cookies.
^Janet: We all know you have a crush on [player]’s mom.
^Hunter: I- I… I do not! And I resent that!
^Janet: I’d like to apologize for Hunter’s behavior.
^Hunter: You can’t apologize for me, Janet!
^Player: Whoa, guys, calm down. No one needs to do any apologizing.
^Player: But to be honest, I haven’t seen my mom for a few days.
^Janet: Like, she’s been busy at work?
^Player: No, she’s just been… gone? I haven’t heard from her, either.
^Janet: You don’t need to state the obvious, dimwit.
^Janet: Yeah, we need to be focused, Hunter.
^Hunter: Do you have a way you could find out where your mom is?
^Janet: Does she have GPS in her car?
^Janet: Then we can use your phone to ping it. Give me your phone [Player].
^There’s no real point in resisting Janet when she gets like this, so I hand over my phone.
^Janet: One sec, annnnnnnd we’re in. Yup, your mom’s car is… in the warehouse district? Weird.
^Hunter: Does your mom go to raves in warehouses? Sick.
^Player: No, I… I don’t know why mom would be there.

s: ^If you both think we should, why not?
^I guess I don’t have anything better to do…

investigate_confirmed: ^Janet: Awesome! We get to be like detectives.
^Hunter: How is that any more silly than being detectives!
^Player: Guys, we should really get going. It’s starting to get dark out.
^I don’t know what it is, but it feels like something bad is going to happen…
WarehouseExt1: ^The warehouse district is pretty scary, even during the day. And it’s almost nighttime.
^Janet: Kinda weird that you could recognize her car so fast.
^Hunter: That’s not fair! I carpool with [Player] a lot!
^To be completely honest, their banter is keeping me from freaking out.
^Janet: Obviously. We’re going to have to go into the warehouse.
^Hunter: Wait what? How do we know this is even the right one?
^Player: I mean, all the other warehouses on the street are boarded up. This one has lights on inside.
^Hunter: That… that is a good point.
^Janet: Come on dorks, time’s wasting. You got your magic ready, [Player]?
WarehouseInt1: ^Janet: That doesn’t matter. We need to be quick, and find anything we can about [Player]’s mom.
^Hunter: Quick… okay, I can get behind that. The sooner we’re outta here the better!
^Janet: And we have to be ready to fight if we need to.
^Janet: We’re not supposed to be here. And if whoever’s running this place took your mom, they’re probably going to want to deal with us themselves.
^Hunter: Is it too late to back out?
